title: How to end a letter with “respectfully submitted” - Quora

response.answer_text: “Respectfully submitted” is generally used at the end of documents that are being submitted to an individual — or more often a body of individuals — for approval. An example would be the Minutes of a meeting (which must be approved by the Board or Committee). A more normal and appropriate usage for letters would be simply: Respectfully, (signature) John Doe, typed, title if appropriate or Respectfully yours, (signature) John Doe, typed, title if appropriate For more details see Writing An Effective Business Letter

I can make you understand by an example suppose during submitting an application for job. Most of the time job seekers withdraw Their Applications. As it may allay their anxiety somewhat to know that their reason is only one of many. They have this mindset, as whatever they’re going to post they will be end up rejected. So there is probably no satisfaction for them to entertain an interviewer. And for ending a letter or job application respectfully they don’t submit it at all…. Same goes during write my essay.
